ShortSummary: Build-time tool that uses Javassist to generate final JDBC proxy classes for HikariCP and injects factory method bodies to instantiate them.
Summary: JavassistProxyFactory generates HikariCP proxy implementations for JDBC interfaces (Connection, Statement, PreparedStatement, CallableStatement, ResultSet, DatabaseMetaData) by creating new final classes (HikariProxy*) that extend existing Proxy* superclasses and implement all relevant interfaces. It auto-generates delegating method bodies, correctly handles SQLException wrapping via checkException, avoids methods already implemented/final in the superclass, accounts for default interface methods and concrete superclass methods, writes classes to target/classes (or a prefixed path), and patches com.zaxxer.hikari.pool.ProxyFactory methods to construct the generated proxies.
MostImportantThings: Generates classes named Hikari<ProxyX> (e.g., HikariProxyConnection) extending com.zaxxer.hikari.pool.Proxy* classes.
Implements all interfaces of the primary JDBC type, deduplicating and skipping methods already provided as final by the superclass.
Method bodies delegate to 'delegate' with try/catch wrapping SQLException -> checkException(e); non-SQLException methods call delegate directly.
If the superclass provides a concrete implementation and the interface method is not a default method, calls super.method(...) instead of delegate.
PreparedStatement and CallableStatement paths require explicit casting of delegate; others do not.
Modifies com.zaxxer.hikari.pool.ProxyFactory to return new generated HikariProxy* instances in its factory methods.
Output directory defaults to target/classes, can be prefixed via CLI arg; classes are emitted with Java 8 classfile version.
Utilities include detection of default methods, SQLException in throws, recursive interface collection, and CtClass-to-Java Class conversion (including arrays/primitives).
RelatedFunctionality: javassist (ClassPool, CtClass, CtMethod, CtNewMethod, LoaderClassPath, ClassFile)
